What is the counter current multiplier mechanism that leads to the concentration of urine in the loop of Henle?
Option 1: Active transport of solute out of the thin section of ascending limb
Option 2: Impermeability to water in thick ascending limb
Option 3: Permeability to solute in descending limb
Option 4: permeability to solute in thick ascending limb
Option 5: permeability to water of thin section ascending limb
Correct Answer: Impermeability to water in thick ascending limb

Option 4: It is filtered, secreted but not reabsorbed

Correct Answer: It is filtered and not reabsorbed
